channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Tensile strain regulation via grain boundary buffering for flexible perovskite solar cells
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67027-6

The residual strain and modulus of polycrystalline films often limit the photovoltaic and mechanical performance of flexible perovskite solar cells. Here, the authors introduce metal chelates for a uniformly distributed tensile strain field, achieving a maximum efficiency of 24.47%.
item.dc:title: Tensile strain regulation via grain boundary buffering for flexible perovskite solar cells
item.dc:creator: Zhiyang Xu

item.title: Recyclable quasi-solid-state dynamic windows via reversible dual-metal electrodeposition for building energy modulation
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 01 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66963-7

In this work, the authors designed an optimized CuZn bimetallic hydrogel electrolyte and assembled a reusable quasi-solid-state dynamic tinting window for building energy modulation.
item.dc:title: Recyclable quasi-solid-state dynamic windows via reversible dual-metal electrodeposition for building energy modulation
item.dc:creator: Bing Xu
Wenting Wu
Yingxin Zhang
Chenglong Qiu
Yue Zhu
Jingyi Wu
Weiqian Tian
Minghua Huang
Huanlei Wang
Pooi See Lee
Jingwei Chen

item.title: Chiral and topological superconductivity in isospin polarized multilayer graphene
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 01 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66902-6

Recently, chiral superconductivity has been observed in rhombohedral tetralayer graphene under electron doping, arising from a spin- and valley-polarized normal state. Here, the authors propose a superconducting mechanism based on over-screening of Coulomb interaction due to charge fluctuations.
item.dc:title: Chiral and topological superconductivity in isospin polarized multilayer graphene
item.dc:creator: Max Geier
Margarita Davydova
Liang Fu
